page.title: 02LANGRISH AREA (2)
page.content: This area is essentially agricultural. Most of the land is used for crops such as wheat, barley and oats. There are several farms which are mainly crop farms but there is some beef farming. The land in the south is mainly permanent pasture or dairy cows, but in the north, rape is being introduced for its oil. Although there is a lot of agricultural land, a reasonable amount of woodland remains. A large percentage is decidous woodland including a large amount of beech trees. Many flowers grow and flourish in these woods, copses and hangers. The land in this area is quite hilly and covered in a network of footpaths for the walker. This rural area has few large roads, sparse postal services and only two churches. This is not an important historic area but contains a few earthworks.
